org.gearvrf

Class GVRMeshCollider

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gearvrf.GVRHybridObject
      • org.gearvrf.GVRComponent
        • org.gearvrf.GVRCollider
          • org.gearvrf.GVRMeshCollider

  • public class GVRMeshCollider
extends GVRCollider
    Represents collision geometry that is a mesh. A GVRCollider is something that is being pointed at by a picking ray. Colliders are attached to scene objects. The GVRPicker will return an array of GVRColliders: you use GVRComponent.getOwnerObject() to retrieve the scene object.

    A MeshCollider holds the GVRMesh that the picking ray will be tested against. If no mesh is specified, it will use the mesh attached to the GVRSceneObject that owns it. You do not need to wait for the mesh to load before attaching the collider. If the scene object that owns the mesh collider does not have a mesh and the mesh collider doesn't have one, the scene object will not be pickable.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GVRMeshCollider

        public GVRMeshCollider(GVRContext gvrContext,
                       GVRMesh mesh)
        Constructor to make mesh collider and attach a mesh. When the mesh is complicated, it will be cheaper - though less accurate - to use the bounding box instead of the mesh.
        Parameters:
        gvrContext - The GVRContext used by the app.
        mesh - The GVRMesh that the picking ray will test against.

      • GVRMeshCollider

        public GVRMeshCollider(GVRContext gvrContext,
                       GVRMesh mesh,
                       boolean pickCoordinates)
        Constructor to make mesh collider that supports coordinate picking such as texture coordinates and Barycentric coordinates.
        Parameters:
        gvrContext - The GVRContext used by the app.
        mesh - The GVRMesh that the picking ray will test against.
        pickCoordinates - If true, coordinate information will be supplied in GVRPicker.GVRPickedObject.

      • GVRMeshCollider

        public GVRMeshCollider(GVRContext gvrContext,
                       boolean useMeshBounds)
        Constructor to make mesh collider without a mesh. The collider will use the mesh attached to the scene object that owns it. If there is no mesh on that scene object, the collider will never be picked. Your application does not have to wait for the mesh to load before attaching a collider - it will become pickable when the mesh becomes available.
        Parameters:
        gvrContext - The GVRContext used by the app.
        useMeshBounds - If true, the mesh bounding box is used instead of the mesh.

      • GVRMeshCollider

        public GVRMeshCollider(GVRMesh mesh)
        Simple constructor. When the mesh is complicated, it will be cheaper - though less accurate - to use GVRMesh.getBoundingBox() instead of the raw mesh.
        Parameters:
        mesh - The GVRMesh that the picking ray will test against.
